name: Referrals
description: Measured data on referrals provide a way to monitor traffic pointed to your website and to investigate whether the traffic is healthy. This tests verify that: </br>1) there is no significant referral yesterday which was not present the previous day, </br>2) sessions from none of the referrals have increased significantly yesterday.

constants.name: minimalCurrentSessionsUnexpected
constants.description: referrals included in check for unexpected referrals if they have more sessions

constants.name: minimalPreviousSessionsIncrease
constants.description: referrals included in check for increase if they previously had more sessions

constants.name: maximalAllowedPercIncrease
constants.description: percentage increase of sessions above this parameter is marked as significant unexpected increase

blocks.description: There is no unexpected large source not present before
blocks.passMessage: No unexpected referrals yesterday with more than ${minimalCurrentSessionsUnexpected} sessions
blocks.failMessage: There are some unexpected referrals yesterday with more than ${minimalCurrentSessionsUnexpected} sessions

blocks.description: There is no unexpected increase in any of the existing sources
blocks.passMessage: No referrals increased significantly yesterday compared to previous period.
blocks.failMessage: 2) Some referrals increased by more than ${maximalAllowedPercIncrease} percent yesterday compared to previous period.
